source.title: Hippocampal replay reflects specific past experiences rather than a plan for subsequent choice

confidence_rationale: Findings challenge a strict immediate-planning interpretation of replay and indicate memory-maintenance roles, supporting a hybridized MECH-056 with tighter scope and explicit boundary conditions.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Replay content tracked salient past experiences and did not consistently predict immediate subsequent choice planning.
mapping.ree_translation: Constrains MECH-056: trajectory-first mechanisms should not be interpreted as universally immediate action planners; architecture needs a memory-maintenance branch and planning guardrails.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Does not negate trajectory relevance; refines where and when trajectory signals should drive commitment-facing pathways.
mapping.source_context: Large-scale hippocampal replay decoding during memory-guided behavior.

confidence_components.notes: High-quality disconfirming/mixed evidence that motivates scope narrowing rather than full rejection.
